record_data.record_plain_text:
AURORA GENERATION, LLC RATE SCHEDULE FERC NO. 1
Reactive Supply and Voltage Control from Generation Sources Service
Aurora Generation, LLC ( Aurora ) provides Reactive Supply and Voltage Control from Generation Sources Service ( Reactive Supply Service ) from the Aurora Facility located 40 miles west of Chicago, Illinois in the PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ( PJM ) region. This Rate Schedule FERC No. 1 sets forth Aurora s revenue requirements for the provision of Reactive Supply Service from the Aurora Facility, as contemplated by the revised Schedule 2 of the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff, filed in Docket No. ER00-3327-000, which provides for PJM to pay generation owners their monthly revenue requirements for Reactive Supply Services.
Aurora s stated Monthly Revenue Requirement is based on Aurora s six General Electric LM 6000 generators rated at 43.5MW each, and four General Electric Frame 7FA generators rated at 153MW each, at the Aurora Facility.
Total Annual Revenue Requirement is $1,490,000 Total Monthly Revenue Requirement is $1,490,000/12 = $124,166.67
Aurora may receive revenues for Lost Opportunity Costs calculated and distributed to Aurora in accordance with Section 3.2.3(f) of the Amended and Restated Operating Agreement of PJM Interconnection, LLC, as amended from time to time.
Upon notice to PJM of the deactivation or reactivation of a generator subject to this rate schedule, the stated Monthly Revenue Requirement shall be reduced or increased to reflect the generator s deactivation or reactivation, respectively through the application of the following formula:
Aurora s Monthly Revenue Requirement shall be decreased by $7,379.91 for each deactivated LM 6000 generator, and by $19,971.80 for each deactivated Frame 7FA generator.
Aurora s Monthly Revenue Requirement shall be increased by $7,379.91 for each reactivated LM 6000 generator, and by $19,971.80 for each reactivated Frame 7FA generator.
Any decreases or increases to Aurora s Monthly Revenue Requirement due to generator deactivation or reactivation shall be effective as of the first day of the month following deactivation or reactivation of the generator(s), in order to be consistent with PJM s billing cycle, providing that in no event will the reduction or increase in the Monthly Revenue Requirement precede the deactivation or reactivation of the generator(s).
record_data.filing_title: Notice of Succession and Revised Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: Aurora Generation, LLC Market-Based Rate Tariff 1. Availability. Aurora Generation, LLC (“Seller”) sells electric energy, capacity, and ancillary services at wholesale under this Tariff to any purchaser for resale with whom Seller has contracted, except as prohibited below. RTO/ISO Specific PJM: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. (“PJM”) and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. MISO: Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. (“MISO”) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to MISO. 2. Applicability. This Tariff is applicable to all wholesale sales of energy, capacity, and/or ancillary services by Seller that are not otherwise subject to a particular rate schedule or contract of Seller. 3. Rates. All sales made under this Tariff shall be made at the rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Seller. 4. Other Terms and Conditions. All other terms and conditions of sale shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and Seller. 5. Compliance with Commission Regulations. Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Seller’s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the Seller’s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Seller’s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 6. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority. The Commission has granted Seller in Aurora Generation, LLC, Docket No. ER16-1732-000 (July 7, 2016) (unpublished letter order), the following limitations and exemptions: (i) waivers of Parts 41, 101 (except that waiver of the provisions of Part 101 that apply to hydropower licensees was not granted with respect to licensed hydropower projects) and 141 (except section 141.15) of the Commission’s accounting and periodic reporting requirements, (ii) waivers of Subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission’s regulations requiring the filing of cost-of-service information, except as to sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16, and (iii) blanket authorization for all future issuances of securities or assumptions of liabilities pursuant to Section 204 of the Federal Power Act, 16 U.S.C. § 824e, and Part 34 of the Commission’s regulations. 7. Seller Category. Seller is a Category 2 Seller, as defined in 18 CFR § 35.36(a), in the Northeast region, and a Category 1 Seller, as defined in 18 CFR § 35.36(a), in all other regions. 8. Effective Date. This Tariff is effective on and after the date on which the Commission permits it to become effective.
